titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Eleanor Jane Terhune Lemann, a 1941 graduate of Bryn Mawr College, was a psychologist and vocational counselor. During World War II, she worked at the Philadelphia State Hospital as a ward attendant, librarian and assistant director of the women's unit. Later, she worked at the Tulane University Bureau of Psychological Services and at Orleans Parish Prison.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of course notes and class materials of Eleanor J. Terhune. Notebooks are for courses on social psychology, comparative psychology, mental measurements, abnormal psychology, economics, philosophy, anthropology, and others. Also included are worksheets from psychology experiments, several exams and papers, and reading lists.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
